title: Teenagers speak out on social media ban | 7NEWS
description: Sixteen high school students share their perspectives on Australia's under-16 social media ban in a studio discussion. The teenagers express mixed views, with some believing they'll find ways around the restrictions while others support the government's decision, despite feeling excluded from the consultation process. Students discuss their experiences with harmful content, the benefits of social media for communication and learning, and concerns about self-esteem impacts from platforms like TikTok and Snapchat. title: Support for Luigi Mangione outside Manhattan Criminal Courthouse
description: Luigi Mangione's supporters have gathered outside Manhattan Criminal Courthouse with a mobile digital billboard truck, arguing his amendment rights have been violated. Mangione made his latest court appearance in Manhattan on December 1 over the alleged murder of United Healthcare CEO Brian Thompson. #luigimangione #deathpenalty #amendmentrights #manhattancriminalcourthouse

title: Temp teacher charged with child sex crimes; Shoppers in pepper spray crossfire | 7NEWS Adelaide
description: A 51-year-old relief teacher, who has worked across eight schools in Adelaide, has been arrested and charged with child sex crimes. During a dramatic arrest at a mall, innocent shoppers have been caught in police officers' pepper spray crossfire. The shopping centre was forced to evacuate, while bystanders needed treatment from paramedics. title: Second Ashes Test preview from the Gabba, Brisbane | 7NEWS
description: Mel McLaughlin, Bharat Sundaresan and Peter Lalor preview the day-night Ashes Test from the Gabba in Brisbane. description: Aussies living with blindness and impaired vision are urging the government for improved accessibility on air travel. title: 11-year-old girl braves a snake bite; Perth's commercial fishing ban underway | 7NEWS Perth
description: A young girl from Perth has come face-to-face with one of the world's deadliest snakes and survives the bite after being treated in hospital for twelve hours. Fisheries Minister Jackie Jarvis has stated that anyone who is caught fishing for demersal fish will face the courts, following a permanent ban on the prized species. title: Teenagers speak out on social media ban
description: Australian teenagers share their perspectives on the social media ban for users under 16. Students discuss concerns about circumventing the ban with parental help, exposure to harmful content, and the unfairness of blanket restrictions on mature users. #socialmedia #under16ban #Australia #students
